skill.name: app-store-changelog
skill.description: Create user-facing App Store release notes by collecting and summarizing all user-impacting changes since the last git tag (or a specified ref). Use when asked to generate a comprehensive release changelog, App Store "What's New" text, or release notes based on git history or tags.
skill.summary: Create user-facing App Store release notes by collecting and summarizing all user-impacting changes ...
skill.author: Dimillian

security_audit.summary: All 27 static findings are FALSE_POSITIVES. This is a legitimate changelog generation tool. The scanner misidentified: git command outputs as 'weak cryptographic algorithms', standard git operations as 'system reconnaissance', markdown code formatting as 'shell backtick execution', and a GitHub repository URL as 'hardcoded URL'. The bash script only executes predefined git commands (log, describe, rev-parse) with hardcoded arguments. No network access beyond reading local git repository. No command injection vectors or arbitrary code execution.

content.value_statement: Writing clear App Store release notes takes time and careful wording. This skill collects changes from your git history since the last release and transforms technical commits into user-friendly What is New text.
actual_capabilities: Collect commits and changed files since the last git tag
Filter commits to identify user-impacting changes
Group changes by theme (New, Improved, Fixed)
Generate user-facing release notes with clear language
Validate output against original git changes
limitations: Does not auto-publish to App Store Connect
Requires git repository with tags for version tracking
Does not integrate with third-party services
Manual review of output recommended before publishing

use_cases.title: Release Summaries

prompt_templates.prompt: Generate App Store release notes grouped by New Features, Improvements, and Bug Fixes.

output: New: Introduced weekly digest notifications for users
Improved: Reduced battery consumption during background sync
Fixed: Crash when opening image attachments in chat
New: Added Spanish and French language support

best_practices: Run the collect_release_changes.sh script from your repository root
Review and edit the output before publishing to catch ambiguous changes
Use specific git tags for precise version boundaries
Group related changes thematically for better readability
anti_patterns: Publishing without reviewing generated notes for technical jargon
Using unreviewed AI output directly in production App Store listings
Skipping validation that bullets map to actual git changes
Including internal ticket numbers or file paths in final notes

faq.question: Which App Stores are supported?
faq.answer: Works with any store that accepts text-based release notes including Apple App Store, Google Play Store, and web app marketplaces.

faq.question: How many bullets should I include?
faq.answer: The skill generates 5 to 10 bullets by default. Adjust based on store limits and the significance of changes.

faq.question: Does it integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The skill itself does not integrate with CI/CD. Use the bash script in your pipeline to collect changes, then feed them to the skill.

faq.question: Is my git data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No network calls are made. The bash script reads your local git repository and the skill processes data locally.

faq.question: What if no git tags exist?
faq.answer: The script falls back to collecting all git history. Provide a specific ref to define the starting point.

faq.question: How is this different from conventional changelog tools?
faq.answer: This skill translates technical commits into plain language for users. Conventional tools often list all commits verbatim.
